definition: mountain/hill/anything that resembles a mountain/CL:座[zuo4]/bundled straw in which silkworms spin cocoons/gable

sentences.english: After the overthrow of the Qing dynasty, Shanxi was held by warlord Yan Xishan.
sentences.chinese: 清朝被推翻後，山西被軍閥閻錫山佔領。

sentences.english: "Cong" people "-Chun Man", that is, "Yuzhou Man" and the "Liao" originated with "Pu" Family.
sentences.chinese: 閻錫山幕僚是民國時期一個重要的軍人幕僚羣體。

sentences.english: But Yan Hsi-shan was still like a trapped beast.
sentences.chinese: 但是，閻錫山仍然在作困獸之鬥。

sentences.english: The old army refers to the troops under Yen Hsi-shan, the Kuomintang warlord in Shansi;
sentences.chinese: 舊軍，指國民黨山西地方實力派閻錫山指揮的晉綏軍。

sentences.english: One column was led by Yan Xishan, and against it we fought the Shangdang Campaign.
sentences.chinese: 一路是閻錫山，我們就手打了個上黨戰役。

sentences.english: This equally applies to the appraisal of Yan Xishan's localism.
sentences.chinese: 對閻錫山的地方主義的評價亦應如此。

definition: Chen Jiongming (1878-1933), a leading warlord of Guangdong faction, defeated in 1925 and fled to Hong Kong
Feng Yuxiang (1882-1948), warlord during Republic of China, strongly critical of Chiang Kai-shek
United Front (either of the two alliances between the Guomindang and the Communist Party, 1923-1927 and 1937-1945)
Autumn Harvest Uprising (1927), insurrection in Hunan and Jiangxi provinces led by Mao Zedong
old name for district of Hohhot city 呼和浩特[Hu1 he2 hao4 te4], Inner Mongolia
Yang Hucheng (1893-1949), Chinese warlord and Nationalist general
Xiao Qian (1910-1999), Mongolian-born, Cambridge-educated journalist active during Second World War in Europe, subsequently famous author and translator
mutiny/(Tw) to be dumped by one's girlfriend while serving in the army
